p: In ear edema induced by croton oil, LEO reduced edema formation, MPO activity, and nitrite levels, but in high concentrations (2.5â€‰mg/ear) this effect is not observed, and LEO did not reduce edema formation but rather presented an irritative response, increasing edema by 16.5% compared to croton oil. Several studies demonstrated that the lavender has an irritating effect after their exposure to the skin [ 32, 33]. The constituents present in the essential oil of lavender oxidize when exposed to air and can cause skin irritation [ 34]. Under such conditions, the topical use of lavender in perfumes, cosmetics, and cleaning products should be done with caution.
